item.title: SSH ForwardAgent Gotchas
item.description: So, you‚Äôre trying to create an SSH Tunnel to your remote machine to make some gitlab/github clones. That‚Äôs all fine and well until you don‚Äôt want to post your password on to the terminal. First, look at you ~/.ssh/config file and add the ‚ÄúForwardAgent yes‚Äù to that machines ip. 1Host 35.242.133.24 2¬†IdentityFile ~/.ssh/id_rsa 3¬†ForwardAgent yes That says to use your local private key as identification when accessing gitlab on your remote‚Äôs machine.

item.title: Postgres Is Now Running
item.description: My macbook has OSX Mavericks installed and sometimes it crashes for no reason, breaking my local postgres server. After restarting and running again "$ brew services postgres", Postgres becomes yellow and I end up spending sometime looking confused and frustrated. Looking at the logs you can get a sense of whats happening: 1$ tail -f /usr/local/var/postgres/server.log 2FATAL: lock file "postmaster.pid" already exists Simply removing the lock file that Postgres generates solves this issue:

item.description: Well, after reading a couple of books on the topic, they all talk about the same thing: you should diversify your portfolio. item.title: SEO Tips
item.description: My key takeaways from making this website “SEO friendly”: Use link “tree structure” from homepage. This way, bots and crawlers can find every page on the website Good titles, under 65 characters Meta tags with good keywords under 100 characters Add “alt” tag to images 1<img alt="About me picture" src="/images/about.jpeg"> External Resources Below is a list of free tools that help you analyze your website and see what can be improved:

item.title: Get Paid For Pooping
item.description: Yes I know it sounds dumb but, if during your working hours you go to the toilet, technically, you are getting paid for it. üí© Use case Alright, lets say you you earn $10 an hour and during those 8 hours of daily work, you go twice to the bathroom, for around 10 minutes each time. Then a simple multiplication shows that your “poop time” is worth around $3.34 per day!

item.title: Hello World
item.description: Hello üòÉ So this is the mandatory “Hello World” blog post. The intent of this blog is just to keep track of my achievements, projects and also Technical how-to/tutorials Bugs or gotchas that might be useful in the future Setup & configuration Stuff that I keep forgetting and keep googling.
